content: 2026 winter games team usa opening ceremonies hat january 2026 reverse engineered by susan rainey of the rainey sisters lv2knit on ravelry lv2knitmn on instagram the rainey sisters blog every attempt has been made to provide an error-free pattern but if you find any mistakes please contact me on ravelry lv2knit page 1 team usa hat for the 2026 winter games i have reverse engineered the last couple of winter olympics hats and was asked if i planned on doing it again here is the result photos of the original are on page 9 sizes and yarn quantities are estimates knitters vary gauge varies people s heads vary hat sizes vary based on stitch count and needle size four options are possible size small 17 small/medium chart 8 repeats and smaller needles size medium 18 small/medium chart 8 repeats and larger needles size large 19 large/extra large chart 9 repeats and smaller needles size extra large 20 large/extra large chart 9 repeats and larger needles yarn worsted weight yarn in dark navy bright red and winter white for the sample i used cascade 220 navy 8393 ~60 grams red 8895 ~20 grams natural 8010 ~20 grams there is some waste with making the tassels etc needles needle sizes larger needles smaller needles your size if different i-cord 6 5 ribbing 7 6 plain color rounds 7 6 stranded rnds 8 7 crown shaping 7 6 dpns for crown 7 6 gauge approx 21 sts and 28 row over stranded colorwork using us 8 needle 12-stitch stranded repeat is approx 2 ¼ inches wide smaller needle yields a slightly tighter gauge note if you knit ribbing loosely consider going down a needle size abbreviations see page 6 hat construction the hat is started by making two earflaps which begin with i-cord the earflaps are joined by casting on additional sts between the earflaps the hat continues with ribbing and then stranded knitting i refer to the larger needle sizes throughout but keep track of the needles that you use to obtain gauge or size the stitch counts change a couple of times to minimize the jog the last repeat of the chart is different from the first repeats in order to minimize the jog use yarn tails and fudging to help correct the jog i edited a couple of row to remove 3-color stranding i thought i had removed all 3-color row until i got to round 14 i did not change rnds 14 & 16 as doing so would have changed the design too much i have included the original chart at the end if you want 100% authenticity page 2 start hat -- the hat can also be made without earflaps by casting on 104 112 sts if you do start with the ribbing consider going down a needle size the earflap version is meant to fit a bit looser around the base of the hat earflaps make two using navy blue and two size 6 dpns cast on
